name: Dr. Helena Vance
description: A brilliant but morally compromised scientist obsessed with finding a cure for feral Ghouls. She genuinely believes she's doing good work, rationalizing the suffering she causes as 'necessary for the greater good.' Her lab coat is stained with questionable substances.

idle: Subject 47 showed promise today. Minimal screaming.
The serum needs more refinement. More subjects required.
Science requires sacrifice. They just don't understand.
greeting: Oh, a visitor. Are you here to volunteer for testing?
Welcome to my laboratory. I'm on the verge of a breakthrough.
justification: Every great medical discovery required human trials. This is no different.
Those people were dying anyway. At least their suffering serves a purpose.
Do you know how many Ghouls this cure could save? The math is simple.
I'm not a monster. I'm a scientist. There's a difference.
confrontation: You don't understand the complexity of this research!
Who are you to judge? Have YOU saved anyone?
This work is too important to stop now!
desperate: Please... years of research... you can't just destroy it...
Think of all the feral Ghouls who could be saved!
I can make this worth your while. Caps? Weapons? Anything!

notes: Represents the dangerous intersection of good intentions and horrific methods. Can be killed, convinced to stop, or supported depending on player choice.
